backend/main.mo: Motoko actor implementing media feed, profiles, likes, and comments with access-control and blob storage mixins.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries of all frontend source files.
frontend/deploy/dfx-frontend-canister-as: Template showing required dfx.json settings for serving dist/ as frontend assets.
frontend/DEPLOYMENT.md: Guide explaining correct Vite production build deployment for the frontend canister.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base styles defining light/dark theme variables and global styling rules.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point with PWA metadata and root mount; still loads src/main.tsx for dev.
frontend/public/manifest.webmanifest: PWA manifest defining app metadata, colors, and icons.
frontend/public/sw.js: Service worker handling cache versioning, static asset caching, network-first HTML, and offline fallback.
frontend/scripts/deploy-frontend-prod.sh: Automated script to build, verify, and deploy the frontend canister to the Internet Computer.
frontend/scripts/verify-dist-shell.ts: Checks dist output for required files and correct Vite bundling, failing if references or assets are missing.
frontend/scripts/verify-frontend-caniste: Validates dfx.json frontend canister is type assets, uses dist as source, and depends on backend.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main app component handling identity, profile setup, service worker updates, and PIN-gated actions.
frontend/src/components/auth/LoginButton: Login/logout button managing Internet Identity auth flow and query cache clearing.
frontend/src/components/auth/ProfileSetu: Simple form for saving a new user’s display name via profile mutation.
frontend/src/components/capture/VideoCap: Provides camera recording UI with start/stop, playback, error handling, and video submission.
frontend/src/components/comments/Comment: Comment form supporting text, optional image/video upload, validation, and mutation submission.
Renders a list of comments with avatars, text, and optional image or video attachments.
Displays comments in a bottom sheet with loading states and a composer for adding new comments.
frontend/src/components/editor/MediaEdit: Provides a dialog for editing images or videos with filters, text overlays, cropping, and trimming.
frontend/src/components/feed/FeedItem.ts: Represents a single feed item with media playback, interactions, liking, comments, and sharing controls.
frontend/src/components/feed/FeedOverlay: Shows handle and caption overlay on feed items with optional child controls when active.
frontend/src/components/feed/Interaction: Displays like, comment, share, and download buttons with counts and authentication checks.
frontend/src/components/feed/SpeedContro: Dropdown control for adjusting video playback speed.
frontend/src/components/feed/UploadButto: Upload trigger button that opens the upload dialog if the user is authenticated.
frontend/src/components/feed/UploadDialo: Manages media upload flow with file validation, capture, editing, and progress handling. Uses dialogs and mutations to upload images or videos with captions.
frontend/src/components/feed/VideoFeed.t: Displays a scrollable video feed with intersection-based active item detection and deep-link navigation. Handles loading, errors, and smooth scrolling to specific posts.
frontend/src/components/feed/VideoFeedIt: Placeholder file exporting nothing to avoid build errors; FeedItem.tsx is used instead.
frontend/src/components/feed/VideoOverla: Provides play/pause and mute UI controls overlayed on videos.
frontend/src/components/search/SearchBut: Renders a search icon button that opens the SearchDialog.
frontend/src/components/search/SearchDia: Dialog for searching feed items with debounced input, authenticated search requests, and result listing.
frontend/src/components/security/PinChal: Prompts users to enter a PIN for security verification, tracking attempts and triggering success or lockout.
frontend/src/components/security/Securit: Button that opens the SecuritySetupDialog for configuring security settings.
Guides users through creating a PIN and security questions, saving the setup when complete.
Share dialog allowing users to copy a post link or use native sharing when supported.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous backend actor and invalidates dependent queries when it changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useDeviceTrust.ts: Manages a persistent device ID and tracks whether the device is known, with helpers to clear or trust the device.
frontend/src/hooks/useDoubleTap.ts: Provides a ref that detects double‑tap or double‑click events and triggers a callback.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity auth context, loading stored identities, managing login/logout, and exposing status flags.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines hooks for fetching feed items, uploading media, and toggling likes using the backend actor and React Query.
frontend/src/hooks/useSecuritySetup.ts: Stores and retrieves a PIN and security questions in localStorage and provides validation helpers.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind-based global styles defining themes, layout resets, scroll behavior, and mobile-safe viewport handling.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with QueryClient and InternetIdentity providers and renders the root component.
frontend/src/utils/downloadMedia.ts: Fetches a media file and triggers a browser download using a temporary object URL.
frontend/src/utils/mediaEdits.ts: Applies simple canvas edits to images and returns a new file; video edits are stubbed and return the original file.
frontend/src/utils/shareLinks.ts: Generates share URLs, copies text to clipboard, checks native share support, and invokes native sharing when available.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Provides helpers to read, remove, and persist URL parameters using query strings, hash routing, and sessionStorage.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Defines Tailwind setup with custom colors, typography, container settings, animations, and extended theme utilities.
frontend/vite.config.ts: Configures Vite for React with environment variable support, path aliases, build settings, and a dev proxy.
project_state.json: Describes the project’s state, goals, architecture, known issues, and existing features for a TikTok-style web app.
